20110117200919.000|20110117200921.000|TR0|was, in the beginning, hundreds, and then

20110117200923.000|20110117200925.000|TR0|that greeted him.  A lot of the young

20110117204628.000|20110117204630.000|TR0|get out because there was a very strong 
20110117204630.000|20110117204632.000|TR0|east wind blowing to the west.  It was not 
20110117204632.000|20110117204634.000|TR0|favorable for the trip I was going to make.
20110117204634.000|20110117204636.000|TR0|
20110117204636.000|20110117204638.000|TR0|And I listened to the weather radio and 
20110117204638.000|20110117204640.000|TR0|everything to find out what the forecast 
20110117204640.000|20110117204642.000|TR0|was.  I had even investigated the night 
20110117204642.000|20110117204644.000|TR0|before, which I did with a friend of mine, 
20110117204644.000|20110117204646.000|TR0|Glen, in the Legend Point Narina. And I 
20110117204646.000|20110117204648.000|TR0|should have had four or five days of clear

20110117204650.000|20110117204652.000|TR0|
20110117204652.000|20110117204654.000|TR0|BALDWIN:  But you didn't have that.  You 
20110117204654.000|20110117204656.000|TR0|ended up with a huge storm.  Tell me what 
20110117204656.000|20110117204658.000|TR0|happened.
20110117204658.000|20110117204700.000|TR0|
20110117204700.000|20110117204702.000|TR0|HOFFMAN:  No.  I sure did.  Well, as a 
20110117204702.000|20110117204704.000|TR0|practice, if you've got a wind blowing

20110117204706.000|20110117204708.000|TR0|or southeast. Well, northeast was not 
20110117204708.000|20110117204710.000|TR0|going to help me at this point.  That put
